intro: Commelina corbisieri, commonly known as the Madagascar arum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
